result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark A Lloyd was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: All Financial obligations shall be paid to the Clerk of Courts within 60 days unless a payment plan is established.
Shall undergo and follow through with any counseling as directed by agent.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  
Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark A Lloyd

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Payment plan granted in the amount of $50 per month commencing on 9/1  until paid in full

10:11. (15CM244/16CM233) Defendant, Mark A Lloyd, in court with Attorney Scott B Rasmussen.  Legal Intern, Joe Anderoni appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews Stip & Rec. Mr. Anderoni heard. Atty Rasmussen heard. Defendant makes statement. Court revokes DPA and finds guilty of charge in 15CM244.  Court DRI 16CM233.

Court ORDERS:
sentence w/held
one year probation
counseling as deemed appropriate by agent
absolute sobriety
no violent/abusive contact w/ anyone
court costs w/ domestic surcharge
DNA sample
DNA surcharge
Motion hearing on August 11, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Mark A Lloyd in court with attorney Scott B Rasmussen.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Def. will plead today - DPA; victim rights complied with; Court reviews GPQPA & WOR; Court reviews charges/penalties; Def. pleads NC to DC/DAA; stip. to facts; Court finds plea made FV&I, defers finding of guilt and approves DPA; bond cont.

ADDRESS INFO for Mark A Lloyd
Current: 223 Woodland Dr, #15, Beaver Dam, WI 53916 United States  (Effective: 10-28-2015)
Prior: 114 W. State Street, Fox Lake, WI 53933
Fax from Atty Rasmussen updating address

(1:35) Attorney Scott B Rasmussen appeared. Def. FTA for Return Date; State appears by Intern Kevin Schmidt (Klomberg); State requests warrant on Def.'s FTA; recess; 1:40 Case recalled; Def. now appears in person; Atty. Rasmussen heard - JT remains; bond cont.

Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant shall submit a DNA sample at the Dodge County Jail.  Any defendant submitting a DNA sample may ask to have it expunged if applicable charges are dismissed  see Wis. Stat. Sec. 165.77(4).  Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.

9:17 - Defendant Mark A Lloyd in court with attorney Scott B Rasmussen. Intern Kevin Schmidt w/Atty Robert G. Barrington appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges and penalties. Court finds probable cause. RD & JT set. Court sets $500 PA bond with conditions:   Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.   Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.   Defendant shall submit a DNA sample at the Dodge County Jail.  Any defendant submitting a DNA sample may ask to have it expunged if applicable charges are dismissed  see Wis. Stat. Sec. 165.77(4).  Return date scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for November 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Return date scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
